title: Statutory Deadlines Master
subtitle: Legal Time Limits, Event Types, and Holiday Calendars

roleInLitigation.summary: Statutory deadlines define legal time limits for actions - reply periods, appeal windows, compliance dates. Missing a deadline can result in case dismissal, penalties, or loss of rights. This master is CRITICAL for compliance.

faqs.question: How do I add a new type of deadline?
faqs.answer: Create a new event type with: name, base_date_type (which date triggers it), deadline_type (days/working_days/months), deadline_count (from statute), and legal_reference. Test with sample dates.

faqs.question: When should I update the holiday calendar?
faqs.answer: Import the new year calendar in December/January. Add any mid-year declared holidays as announced. Review quarterly for completeness.

faqs.question: What if a deadline is wrong on a case?
faqs.answer: Check event type configuration first. If rule is wrong, fix it and recalculate. If case-specific, you can manually override the calculated date (document reason).

faqs.question: How do extensions work?
faqs.answer: If extension_allowed is true on the event type, the system tracks extension count and calculates new deadline. extension_days defines maximum extension period.

faqs.question: What's the difference between days and working_days?
faqs.answer: Days = calendar days including weekends. Working_days = excludes holidays from calendar. Use working_days when statute says 'working days' or 'excluding holidays'.
